## Top Stories

### 1. OpenAI Strikes Pentagon Deal as Anthropic Faces Federal Ban
**Source**: [Al Jazeera](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/28/openai-strikes-deal-with-pentagon-to-use-tech-in-classified-network), [BBC](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cn48jj3y8ezo), [PBS](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/why-the-trump-administration-is-clashing-with-ai-firm-anthropic)  
**Why it matters**: Major geopolitical realignment in AI-military partnerships. Anthropic's ethical stance on military use triggered Trump to order all federal agencies to stop using their products. OpenAI moved swiftly to fill the gap with a classified network deployment deal. This creates a clear dichotomy: OpenAI = defense-friendly, Anthropic = ethics-first (with commercial consequences).

### 3. AI Made Writing Code Easier. It Made Being an Engineer Harder
**Source**: [ivanturkovic.com](https://www.ivanturkovic.com/2026/02/25/ai-made-writing-code-easier-engineering-harder/) | HN: Rising  
**Why it matters**: Emerging counter-narrative to "AI replaces engineers" panic. Focus shifting to *engineering* (system design, architecture, debugging) vs *coding* (syntax, boilerplate). Validates investment in higher-level skills over code-generation speed.
